document.title: Dance: Blueprint for teaching and learning

73A79B5571CB4890B4CE1CCA06F03980.description:
organize for dance in and out of
school.

3DB44E4175334628BF3B4E0E21C29512.description:
become familiar with a range of
New York City schools, studios and
theaters that offer dance classes,
films, lectures and performances.

58C202E3EBCD41CA827526D6137470B3.description:
attend a variety of dance events in
and outside school.

727612236DFC4E6798FB3835BB4E3C17.description:
dance comfortably at family and
social gatherings.

AD45C972D5BA4693A8AA40480B389A60.description: enjoy dancing with friends at school.

133C83D48DF945809D1B8FA9DA0CC247.description:
Through participating in dance in
school on an ongoing basis, students
will:

237DC9DE4D074F06BC66B94C2FC107A4.description:
Value Dance as a Source of
Enjoyment and Lifelong
Learning

85245F4A11194EE0849D7390C8D215A3.description:
make a work plan for improving weak
areas.

DD1EB04645304A419EEC5C4A2F72A891.description:
identify skills and qualities that
lead to success in the dance field
and in life such as responsibility,
adaptability, organization,
communication, project
management, time management.

67D7AED796044A6E9267CDE2A7779101.description:
through observation and experience,
reflect on personal goals and take
steps to achieve them.

4E5678920F3D40389A89AD8FB58FCAB3.description:
identify elements in a performance
(e.g., passion, commitment,
professionalism) that motivate
students to aspire to excellence.

56D4AF144B024F90A9225BBFF7E76DB1.description:
Through participation in dance over
time, students will:

C348F60B1CB449BC8304DFD0799A48C3.description:
recognize the ways in which dance
experiences support preparation for
allied health and movement fields
(e.g., dance therapy, physical therapy,
occupational therapy, dance science
and medicine).

7B9234DF69EF4B2E933EA08C067C0F3D.description:
understand the relationships between
various professions in and related
to dance (e.g., dance company
manager, publicist, marketing
director, development director,
choreographer).

001B795CDC1F448D92F35D28E4AC9B11.description:
develop an understanding of the skill
sets necessary to function effectively
in dance and dance-related jobs.

7AA04EC1DEDA4A95B5932200ABEB585E.description:
By participating in dance classes and
in various capacities in school dance
productions, students will:

1F6AA85F2F8B4730B94D4EF8ECC624BC.description:
Learn About Careers in and
Related to Dance

48CE9B1AE17F45ECA8EBE45D5EE7BADB.description:
incorporate guidance and correction
from peer or high school dance
students.

F82A6CA6C38B45E4BF25E9FB580D2FD7.description:
guide a peer or younger dance
student with sensitivity.

EA6AE1AE17E748E3AACA6B5288E4682D.description:
share dance notation and
documentation with other students.

09495F2D46B5406A99C55ED7662BB9BA.description:
explain evaluation methods to other
students.

99D89FEF5B33487EAAC69A8D4B973F97.description:
describe the process of learning,
creating and performing dance to
other students.

7E115B51E698475FAC1B5EBD76331764.description:
By sharing analysis of dance with other
dance students, non-dance students,
parents and teachers of various
disciplines, students will:

8B7EE88DFC224867B3251155EF71C434.description:
Share Dance Experiences in
and Between Schools

60D5F7B545F74EC08E37829D82ACB693.description:
make use of published material such
as magazines, periodicals, books
and videos to learn about dance and
dance-related subjects.

DFA66E084F6647DA98D848C1419D09F9.description:
find information about dance in a
variety of libraries and websites.

AAD3661E0A49436C8D898ED9370B4CF3.description:
Students utilize a variety of print, video
and online resources for dance research,
demonstrating the ability to:

913BD50044A342CE8D48672E43EB6329.description:
describe the challenges and rewards
of participating in dance experiences
with a wider community beyond the
school dance community.

0AC0D321F8934D398A7B8C80A53B3419.description:
compare and contrast various dance
cultural institutions in terms of their
mission in the community.

CB01545BCE2E4A0E9249F947EB53A57F.description:
understand the routine of a theatrical
dance performance: ushers, seating,
programs, house and stage lights,
audience attentiveness, performance,
applause.

F97FC112B522487B9E6086D618075405.description:
describe the activities of a dance
company (e.g., training, rehearsals,
performances).

AC33E79817BB4DC897329564215A2A68.description:
Through the school’s participation in
partnerships with dance artists and
institutions, students will:

00A717577EC6474C951AC8EC242FCEA7.description:
Engage With Community and
Cultural Institutions, Colleges
and Universities

8C26316BDCB0424EA384DA282CFC89E7.description: Working with Community and Cultural Resources

1C2205EA3983400691AA8F567B4662FF.description:
describe specific benefits
of good nutrition to dance
performance.

B7038E646320435898864C8F158F8BF4.description:
identify the elements of
nutrition (vitamins, minerals,
fats, carbohydrates, proteins).

43F3B9AE3AE244699CC1953C9EDEBE0D.description:
analyze the effect of dance on
strength, endurance, aerobic
conditioning, flexibility,
coordination, physical
and mental self-control,
emotional state, socialization
and cooperation, spiritual
fulfillment and balance in life.

80A5D91887EC4EE4AF29DA4E3A8EC62A.description:
Through participating in and
reflecting on dance, students will:

43619CC743A448F68A6C260A1FB6AE1E.description:
Connect Dance to Health
and Well-Being

82078FC2D13E4D87B072D63253310974.description:
imagine, envision, describe and
carry out original uses of video
images to enhance a dance
performance.

EAA7BE2F3A4F4CECADF5F07D6806E780.description:
Students understand and use
videotape as a tool for revising
dance and as an integrated part of
performance, and use computer
programs and websites for dance
learning, demonstrating the
ability to:

15BF91AEFDEA4D5689BB03EB76F03D93.description:
Utilize Technology in
Connection With Dance

F4D6266A7DD64620A1019FB5C594430E.description:
incorporate other arts and
disciplines into dance creation
and performance.

E49967FBB6A94C7BA4A6CC6CAB75FE07.description:
respond to dance using
other art media and other
disciplines.

6C155874D1B847B587322B77384D59EB.description:
use ideas and images from
other disciplines to inspire new
approaches to dance study

923672B0EC8345529B2BB4102FD1C7DD.description:
apply basic principles common
to dance and other disciplines
to dance creation.

D334AFB289AE4A918408E64CD4C9F172.description:
By investigating, comparing
and synthesizing ideas common
to dance and other disciplines,
students gain new perspectives
on dance, demonstrating the
ability to:

3367E9ECC9C94CBC86A297D857458624.description:
Connect Dance to Other
Arts and Disciplines

CF5138C6FDEE46C8B983B66A9B3C9263.description:
examine the
impact of significant
national or world events
on dance styles and
production.

6D580C10E722411A99F535AB9061A5E7.description:
examine how dance styles
influence each other
across cultures.

ED221ACF083D44EEAF5C83E57C106EA3.description:
analyze societal mores and how
they affect the way dance is
performed and received.

6DC3E437EC3942AE81EDB669512CF036.description:
identify the participants in and
audience for dance in various
cultures and historical periods.

F138B5953FE243DA8082481CE1DD9BF0.description:
Through critical investigation and
analysis, students understand how
dances evolve and interconnect,
demonstrating the ability to:

0185613E4E1B4A6C9318775260533E92.description:
Understand Dance
History and the Social and
Cultural Significance of
Dance (Theatrical, Ritual &
Social Dances)

C260808A56FA4A3E9C10C3A04F1405DE.description:
describe the relationship to
music in a style.

5F82D3A5A7304432B2A563F1F318570B.description:
understand and infer the
technical demands of a style.

F166EF7651344B379BDE9D79C76E41D0.description:
use dance language to describe
specific aesthetic differences
and similarities between styles
and artists.

FEF313D7070945EEBE3CC674267A1FD8.description:
identify, describe, compare and
contrast at least six different
dance styles and genres.

F00F61B965DE48FDA730775BC683E2BA.description:
Students differentiate a variety
of styles, and gain familiarity
with a range of dance companies
and artists, demonstrating the
ability to:

0C2FA1D81DBB43958E57DDE5281A1105.description:
Identify and Compare
Dance Styles, Genres,
Major Works and Artists

7086E272E8214FA89D9947EA91CC24B4.description:
respond to dance verbally and
in writing.

74592BA2F9A44183870549033376B7B8.description:
speculate on the intent of the
dance and whether it was
successfully communicated.

666A26D411AA45769E3D21F01703F3B5.description:
recall details about costumes,
music and stage design and
analyze their effect on the
performance.

1BD89B0718374D4A86F785F345D2DEB1.description:
analyze dance content and
social/cultural context.

DFCBFEB2DC3E410D8EE72A6DF8B64EED.description:
analyze basic structural
elements of the choreography.

22AC398DDE21418790D1E583A83E5ACF.description:
identify the movement
components in a dance phrase.

6A8B124E72F74E0EABB6408BB35B7ED9.description:
use expressive language to
describe their emotional
responses to performances.

F49E7970197A49CAA74742AAF5A5A4F7.description:
describe the genre or style,
using pertinent style-specific
vocabulary.

765AFC7F893C49AFA701DB7942408915.description:
accurately identify the time
and date, all performer and
non-performer participants,
and venue.

4CC8A260C50247C988FE48A5531CCC70.description:
Students present informed opinions about dance based on stated
criteria and supported by examples
expressed in dance terms, that can
be defended in comparison with
those of peer critics, demonstrating the ability to:

1363E900AF9449F0AFA34643AF74CDDD.description:
Analyze, Critique and
Communicate About
Dance

D6B9F9E19E98406EB38061B0DD6B9CA2.description:
understand stage terminology
and staging concepts (e.g.,
upstaging, crossover, center,
quarter).

E4D34D4B6323461B8C9774CC61D7E01E.description:
use motif symbols or invented
notation to indicate leading
parts of the body

0DAE1E164D154EC8B27997DA99D71478.description:
identify various choreographic
devices (e.g., canon,
accumulation, retrograde) and
structures (e.g., rondo, call and
response).

F00B9A6ECB584D44AA634A8E34BE92A8.description:
use style-specific vocabulary
(e.g., Hip-Hop: lockin’, poppin’,
toprockin’, b-boyin’; Ballet:
enchainement, adagio, en
pointe).

B947C98108474EA8B26AA1AFEB5A89AC.description:
demonstrate and refer to steps
in combination (e.g., run-runleap, chassé, pas de bourrée,
shuffle ball-change flap flap).

C1C812316D0548F38219944A8FA2DE12.description:
use descriptive words in
combination with dance
terminology (e.g., “a syrupy
recovery”).

D8ADACC46BE4459394FB63A738FF21E9.description:
apply contrasting (e.g., fall and
recovery) and synonymous
(e.g., turnout and rotation)
dance words.

4FC1D052BAA64F0CB5175B9EF587C600.description:
Students increase and diversify
dance vocabulary, demonstrating
in dance movement, discussion
and writing the ability to:

D68E5934D6234D458EAABF1BD94D9A8D.description:
Apply Dance Vocabulary,
Terminology and Symbols

DFDF3B33199A41F5B89217D1FF22CC99.description:
analyze the
effects on a viewer
of both personal
aesthetic preferences and physical
point of view.

52BF2B209D9647409FB05912062B594E.description:
analyze the
use of individuals, partners and
groups.

0900B77267614EA09132231A1EDA0DEE.description:
identify a
dance’s specific
relationship to
time, rhythm and
music.

7BFEC50DEAE24F339CC8D5607FF9DC76.description:
understand the effect of spatial
transitions in areas of the stage
space.

0DEFC6C179034E90AB545D6942EE1845.description:
understand and demonstrate
how agreement or contrast
between parts of the body,
dynamic attack, and direct
or indirect motion create
meaning.

DC6EDAAB7D124292B1D812DA2CFA62F1.description:
identify developments and
variations of dance figures
(partnered step combinations).

32B4309911074E26A6B64D7A908DBEE0.description:
identify moments of contrast
and surprise.

F13FF05BC7DD4710A86EC2524B97D4F1.description:
recognize call and response in
dances.

7FB0F01ECE85405FAECD6EC24FEB8EF3.description:
Students understand related and
contrasting elements in dance
that create a movement language,
demonstrating the ability to:

87F8D3F3CBAC4359B7C970B9098A63F2.description:
Understand Dance as a
Means of Expression and
Communication

3253BE4D34394C089D1F7CBDC76B6111.description:
exhibit attentive audience
learning behaviors when
viewing the work of other
students.

245FEB5D50044DCAA9BD4709A011EA16.description:
improve performance
independently in response to
feedback.

857F631E420942EC9688860A36E9882B.description:
collaborate with an ensemble
in rehearsal and performance
decisions.

6F9C050B235E4275A95E2ED6841F3295.description:
dance with rhythmic accuracy
and musical feeling.

E7513C2118F5466A968ED01053A0AB78.description:
dance with physical and
expressive commitment.

E12D4C99616444FFBE6945AE99C2FD91.description:
dance in various styles and
genres, with clear differences
in body posture and attitude.

9D5DF1DA9C9D4735A065235946F8C7C4.description:
change focus, mood and intent
for different dances.

CCD05A5046E64BB287321623E8846FB7.description:
execute internal
entrances and exits on
musical cues with
dependable accuracy.

925CAB5347B94EB4B7DE95F7103E7C3D.description:
recall and reproduce complex
movement phrases and
spatial formations.

E37AA73C36E04E438A5E471184B983DD.description: Students perform, demonstrating the ability to:

81341837C53F42BF825249BE8A2D1AAE.description:
show initiative and
independence in rehearsals.

228E0807BD8B4466A8AFCB0AF54CE8F7.description:
use choreographic designs such
as diagonals, lines, clusters,
entrances, exits.

E3A2685E45994948A8A8EE61A6A12BFC.description:
understand and use
choreographic structures such
as ABA, theme and variation,
canon, call and response,
counterpoint.

1E426DFFCC2C41E5A10A042158A95DAD.description:
juxtapose a unison group
against a solo or duet, and two
or more unison groups against
each other.

81A77B45583942A8BFCDDBCD18AAEF03.description:
use a variety of partnering
techniques.

A38AA9DFA39244928844A385EDD7B897.description:
develop movement motifs to
derive phrases.

9D0F375E0B87467B9ACA69CA32481FD7.description:
use original movement motifs
informed by the genres and
styles studied.

4104545E8A8F4409AB47C2542696564B.description:
incorporate several
sections with a beginning,
development, resolution and
ending.

35571BB0CF2B44E79F6B53898287ADB9.description:
clearly express the intent or
theme of the dance.

6A26170844B9403CB1E10E5AD83FB195.description:
Students create a dance with
peers, demonstrating the ability
to:

6FDB3A91AF3B4438A10F92FBF3B27080.description:
translate rhythmic patterns
from aural to kinesthetic.

96B9954C951943A0A81B83A86EC9D471.description:
work alone, or collaborate with
a partner or mid-size group.

ED9CFC42314141638B84171D31BC82BA.description:
make spontaneous choices
in dance partnering with
sensitivity to the partner.

7CB0AD1628F74927BD205D7D0BCBED6B.description:
improvise non-literal
movement on a dramatic
theme.

D944D02C65FB4224950C5B3FFBFD75EC.description:
transfer spatial patterns from
visual to kinesthetic.

36C3726114B84FF6A51E7F6868EB2769.description:
use gesture as a source of dance
movement.

9B5C1CE3E17C4613BE9A6EF32A09D0B7.description:
vary movement phrases by
changing rhythm, tempo,
dynamics and use of space.

874A483AB5474EFF807C935E1469B1CB.description:
Students develop movement
phrases and examine various
spatial groupings and patterns,
demonstrating the ability to:

BD0475D844054C638ADF7114AD129810.description:
execute movement sequences
in a variety of dance forms
with accuracy.

55B65DF4B364453792068A49D2CE9824.description:
employ various kinds of
partnering techniques.

DA34415285EF4BD492247D841D7A1C7F.description:
move in syncopated rhythms:
dotted rhythms, polyrhythms,
odd meters (e.g., 5/4 time).

29D048B5A721484DA1B180D076BB027A.description:
execute combinations of
steps with transitions in
varied dynamics and spatial
orientations.

21C216996FD94A238856DE0243297F75.description:
demonstrate control and
balance in centered and offcentered movements.

5B4EB0CE3BC94893AE55BF2FE22E421F.description:
coordinate a range of small
and large movements specific
to a style.

C69FA4D3451C48B7BF74C882CD02DF68.description:
demonstrate strength and
flexibility in jumps, deep
bends, turns and extensions.

B3691EA8EB6F471193FDDE823A9378A9.description:
exhibit proper muscle use,
alignment and posture
appropriate to a style.

C2127D1FAF004655987944C8ADB8E83C.description:
Through participation in
technique classes, students learn
theatrical styles, culturally specific
dance forms, and social dances,
achieving the ability to:
